channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Anthropic CEO weighs in on AI bubble talk and risk-taking among competitors
item.description: Anthropic's CEO shared his thoughts on the economics of AI and the risk-taking of competitors, saying some were "YOLO-ing" with regard to spending.

item.title: Jon M. Chu Says AI Couldn’t Have Made One of Wicked’s Best Moments
item.description: The Wicked: For Good director says being able to improvise on set allows for the kind of moments that are hard for machines to make.

item.title: Musk says new Tesla software allows texting and driving, which is illegal in most states
item.description: Texting while driving is banned in nearly every state, even with the use of advanced driver assistance systems like Tesla's Full Self-Driving (Supervised) software.

item.title: Euclid et l'IA révèlent enfin l'origine des prodigieux noyaux actifs de galaxies
item.description: Le rôle des fusions de galaxies dans l'alimentation en matière des trous noirs supermassifs actifs – qui brillent formidablement sous forme de quasars en réponse – fait l'objet de débats depuis longtemps parmi les astronomes. Or, un ensemble de données sans précédent, portant sur un million de...

item.title: Soundpeats Air5 Pro+ Review: Why Are You Still Buying AirPods?
item.description: For $130 you can get some of the best-sounding wireless earbuds I've listened to all year.

item.title: The 67 Best Movies on Disney+, WIRED’s Picks (December 2025)
item.description: Madame Web, Love+War, and The Fantastic Four: First Steps are just a few of the movies you should be watching on Disney+ this month.

item.title: CEOs are warning AI adoption and spending should be more strategic
item.description: Tech companies need to make calculated, strategic decisions about AI’s next phases.

item.title: Trump rolls back Biden-era fuel economy rules, slashing targets for 2031
item.description: The industry says Biden’s standards were “extremely challenging” amid slowing EV demand. Trump calls them “ridiculously burdensome.” As the rest of the world speeds ahead toward an electrified future, the U.S. is doubling down on gas-powered cars.

item.title: Trump will discuss the inflation crisis next week in Philadelphia
item.description: Inflation is tracking at 3% annually, up from 2.3% in April when Trump rolled out sweeping tariffs. President Donald Trump plans to travel to Pennsylvania on Tuesday to highlight his efforts to reduce inflation even as fears mount about a worsening job market and amid signs that Americans are still feeling squeezed by high prices.

item.title: Metroid Prime 4 doesn’t stand up to Nintendo’s best
item.description: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is finally out after a long and difficult development - and despite some bright spots, the game really shows its age. Nintendo has a long and celebrated history of doing things its own way. During the original Switch era, going back to Super Mario Odyssey in 2017, Nintendo has focused on […]

item.title: Palmer Luckey Wants to Take War Underground
item.description: "People think it's some kind of crazy, crazy, nutty thing," said Luckey.

item.title: I went hands-on with Hengbot Sirius, an AI robot that left me wanting more
item.description: It's a bit tipsy

item.title: Amazon slashes the original Blink Mini to a ridiculously low £10
item.description: Amazon slashes the price of the Blink Mini down to just £9.99.

item.title: FBI Says DC Pipe Bomb Suspect Brian Cole Kept Buying Bomb Parts After January 6
item.description: The 30-year-old Virginia resident evaded capture for years after authorities discovered pipe bombs planted near buildings in Washington, DC, the day before the January 6, 2021, Capitol attack.

item.title: ‘Five Nights at Freddy’s 2’ Is at Its Best When It’s Not Bogged Down by Video Game Lore
item.description: Blumhouse follows up its 2023 smash with more animatronic mayhem in a story that tries to have it both ways.

item.title: Amazon’s dynamic pricing is causing chaos for school budgets
item.description: School districts are paying extra for basic supplies thanks to unpredictable dynamic pricing on Amazon, which is costing them on average 17 percent more, according to a report by the Institute for Local Self-Reliance (ILSR). Unlike the contracts schools and local governments would traditionally make with local suppliers, who would bid to offer the best […]...

item.title: Trump admin may deny H1-B visas to people who worked in content moderation, report says
item.description: The Trump administration has ordered US consulates to consider rejecting H1-B visa applicants involved in content moderation or “censorship,” according to a report from Reuters. A State Department cable viewed by the outlet says officials should check an applicant’s resume or LinkedIn profile for a job history involving moderation, fact-checking, online safety, compliance, and misinformation. […]...

item.title: AWS Graviton5 is its most powerful and efficient CPU to date - and could mean big changes for your key cloud workloads
item.description: Fastest and more efficient performance for AI workloads is coming with AWS Graviton5.

item.title: Chatbots Show Promise in Swaying Voters, Researchers Find
item.description: How far are we from a chatbot president?

item.title: Microsoft is quietly walking back its diversity efforts
item.description: Microsoft has been publishing data about the gender, race, and ethnic breakdown of its employees for more than a decade. Since 2019 it's been publishing a full diversity and inclusion report annually, and at the same time made reporting on diversity a requirement for employee performance reviews. Now it's scrapping its diversity report and dropping […]...

item.title: The future for women investors is in danger
item.description: Cultural and political shifts and tight markets are making it increasingly tough for women-led funds to preserve their hard-fought gains. Only about 10 percent of venture funds ever make it to a fourth vintage. Of those, just 5 to 10 percent are led by women. I’m one of them.

item.title: North Face x Skims is hitting the slopes for a second season
item.description: With North Face x Skims and Jacquemus x Nike, this winter, skiing is a state of mind. It’s a great week to have a disposable income and act like you know how to ski.

item.title: Grindr for lesbians? Here are the best dating apps for LGBTQ women.
item.description: Looking for love, friends, or casual fun? We've curated a list of the best dating apps for lesbians, from HER to Hinge.

item.title: Face aux smartphones noirs et tristes, le Motorola Edge 70 Pantone Color of the Year 2026 fait un bien fou
item.description: C'est devenu un rituel. Chaque année, Motorola s'accapare la couleur Pantone pour tenter de se différencier. Cette fois, avec le Edge 70, ils vont plus loin. Finesse extrême de 5,99 mm, finition "Cloud Dancer" et cristaux incrustés.

item.title: Amazon Scribe and Scribe Colorsoft launch date announced: New e-readers will finally be available soon
item.description: Amazon has officially provided a launch date for the Kindle Scribe Colorsoft. First announced on Sept. 30, the new Kindle Scribe and Kindle Scribe Colorsoft will finally be available for purchase on Dec. 10.

item.title: AMD CEO Lisa Su Says Concerns About an AI Bubble Are Overblown
item.description: Lisa Su leads Nvidia’s biggest rival in the AI chip market. When asked at WIRED’s Big Interview event if AI is a bubble, the company’s CEO said, “Emphatically, from my perspective, no.”

item.title: From the NFL to Startup Battlefield: How Alltroo built a brand that wins
item.description: On season one of Build Mode: Product, Meet Market, we explore what it really takes to get your product into the hands of customers.

item.title: Google’s AI model is getting really good at spoofing phone photos
item.description: I'm starting to understand where Google's visual AI model gets its name, because after playing around with it for a couple of days, that's how I'd sum it up: bananas. The images it generates are so realistic it's bananas. I feel like I'm going bananas after staring at them for too long. And if I […]

item.title: Russia blocks FaceTime and Snapchat, tightening its control online
item.description: The announcement comes after the Kremlin blocked Roblox, Signal, Twitter, and many other online platforms. Russian authorities said Thursday they have imposed restrictions on Apple’s video calling service FaceTime, the latest step in an effort to tighten control over the internet and communications online.

item.title: La crise est telle que Samsung refuse de se vendre de la RAM à lui-même
item.description: Si vous avez observé le secteur des composants PC ces derniers temps, il est impossible que vous soyez passé à côté de la crise qui touche le marché de la RAM dont tous les composants sont siphonnés par l’industrie de l’IA. Samsung le sait mieux que personne.

item.title: Legal AI startup Harvey confirms $8B valuation
item.description: Harvey confirms a third enormous round of funding in 2025 that has skyrocketed its valuation. Again.
